summary: This document is a forwarded email containing a public statement from Prince Andrew, the Duke of York, regarding his association with Jeffrey Epstein. In the statement, dated November 20, 2019, Prince Andrew announces he is stepping back from public duties and expresses regret for his association with Epstein, while offering to assist law enforcement.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.role: The Duke of York, Royal Family Member
persons.context: Issues a public statement announcing he will step back from public duties due to the disruption caused by his past association with Jeffrey Epstein. He expresses regret and offers to assist law enforcement.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as the deceased individual with whom Prince Andrew had an 'ill-judged association.' His suicide is mentioned as leaving unanswered questions for his victims.

persons.name: Her Majesty
persons.role: The Queen of the United Kingdom
persons.context: Prince Andrew states he asked for and received her permission to step back from his public duties.

connections.description: Prince Andrew describes a past 'association' with Jeffrey Epstein, which he now calls 'ill-judged' and a source of major disruption.

events.title: Prince Andrew's Public Statement
events.description: Prince Andrew releases a statement announcing he will step back from public duties due to the fallout from his association with Jeffrey Epstein. He expresses regret and offers to assist law enforcement.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's Suicide
events.description: Referenced in the statement as an event that 'left many unanswered questions, particularly for his victims.'

keyFacts: Prince Andrew publicly announced he was stepping back from all public duties on November 20, 2019, due to the disruption caused by his association with Jeffrey Epstein.
The statement contains Prince Andrew's first public expression of regret for his 'ill-judged association' with Jeffrey Epstein.
Prince Andrew offered to help 'any appropriate law enforcement agency with their investigations' into matters related to Epstein.
The statement acknowledges Epstein's suicide and the unresolved questions and need for closure for his victims.
